summary: Netflix is set to invest over 1 billion euros ($1.14 billion) to produce content in Spain over the next four years . The streaming giant's co-CEO, Ted Sarandos, told an event in Madrid on Tuesday .

Netflix has emerged as a popular opportunity among growth-stock investors this year . Management has a plan to double revenue and triple operating income over the next five years . The company is hoping to achieve a trillion-dollar valuation by 2030 .  Netflix shares are up 39% so far in 2025 . The company looks poised to continue its monster run . President Donald Trump's tariff policies have dampened enthusiasm in the stock market this year .  Netflix is a streaming business -- making revenue from subscriptions to its digital content catalog of movies and television . Since Netflix's core business doesn't rely on manufacturing physical products or the dynamics of imports and exports, the company is essentially insulated from the threats tariffs pose to other companies, such as retailers .  Netflix is well aware that the streaming landscape is becoming increasingly more intense . Despite its first-mover advantage, Netflix now faces competition from Walt Disney, Paramount Global, Warner Bros. Discovery, and even big tech platforms such as Amazon, Alphabet, and Apple . Netflix has invested heavily in developing its own original content, as well as expanding into live broadcasting .  Netflix would need to trade at a price-to-sales (P/S) multiple of 12.5 or 30 times its operating income to reach $1 trillion in market cap . Both subscription revenue and advertising sales are high-margin for Netflix . Unless Netflix starts to show meaningful signs of deceleration, I don't see its valuation multiples contracting in a meaningful way .  I think Netflix can sustain a premium valuation in the long run . The caveat is that a lot needs to go right for the company over the next five years . I think that for investors, the prudent thing to do is to monitor how the company's investments in original content and advertising keep moving the needle .
